title: Man City news: Pep Guardiola feels he's proven point with Monaco win | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 10:08 am Pep Guardiola’s side played some great football to beat Monaco (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola believes he has silenced his critics after the thrilling nature of his side’s win over Monaco in last night’s Champions League tie. 
The Spanish tactician hasn’t had the most convincing start in the Premier League after moving to City in the summer, but they put on an outstanding attacking display to win 5-3 on Tuesday night. Antoine Griezmann breaks silence over Manchester United transfer speculation 
City will be disappointed at conceding three away goals at the Etihad Stadium, but look in a strong position to make it through to the quarter-finals after taking the lead in the tie. 
Guardiola was in bullish mood afterwards, perhaps taking a swipe back at his critics by proclaiming that games like this are why the club were so keen to appoint him as manager. Man City hit five goals to stage a thrilling comeback (Picture: Getty) 
‘We attacked in small spaces, we defended huge spaces behind, Guardiola said after the match. 
‘That is why they wanted me to come here – I love to play in that way, I think it is something special when two teams play in that way, attack and attack. In the end the football is marvellous. 
‘It was a special game, I cannot deny that. Ups and downs. We attacked quite good, our build-up was quite slow, but it was not easy because Monaco are so organised.’
